content.description: A tough start leads to a rest and then onto an ear that trends right and then up. This is a little pumpy and has some small but good holds.
content.protection: Bolts and maybe a 0.5 cam for the easy runout to the top? Lower off or rap.
content.location: It is the second route from the left.

content.description:
This is a trad route for people experienced in trad pro options or figure the gear on rap first (lame).

Like the rest of the wall, it is really pumpy, because the wall has a big bulge shape, and now you're looking for gear. The finish is on the face to the right of the crack, a little "R"-ish but ok if you were to fall. All the gear is good, really.
content.protection:
A certain tapered, medium nut size or the green/yellow offset Alien is the bomber second piece.

1 - 0.4 cam.

1 - 0.5 cam.

1 - 0.75 cam.

1 - #1 cam.

1 - #2 cam.

1 - #3 cam.

FYI, these were not necessarily placed in that order!
content.location: This is the second route from the right side. It is the obvious crack.

content.description: Barstool is just continuous crimping on the first 1/2. There is no real crux. It is an ok warmup that's not 5.11 and up.
content.protection: 6-7 bolts and the anchor. Rap off when cleaning or add biners.
content.location: This is the first route on the left.

content.description: This is a 5 bolt boulder problem. It is relentless and powerful! The crux is at the 3rd-4th bolt.
content.location: This is the rightmost route on the wall. The crack is just to the left and shares the anchor.
